p: To date, no standardized case definitions or laboratory diagnosis algorithms have been recorded for Mayaro fever at the regional or country levels in Latin America and the Caribbean. Similarly, information on country-level MAYV surveillance efforts in Latin America and the Caribbean were not available in academic literature or from health authorities. However, many of the cases reported in academic literature came about from the differential diagnosis of sera that were negative for other, more well-known arboviral diseases ( 1, 18, 21- 23, 26, 34, 39, 42, 46- 48).
